qas.question: What overlooks the bay of Montevideo?
What replaced the observation post in 1802?
When did construction of the fortress begin?
When did construction of the fortress finish?

context: <a0_0>Fortaleza del Cerro<a0_0/> overlooks the bay of Montevideo. An observation post at this location was first built by the Spanish in the late 18th century. In 1802, <a1_0>a beacon<a1_0/> replaced the observation post; construction of the fortress began in <a2_0>1809<a2_0/> and was completed in <a3_0>1839<a3_0/>. It has been involved in many historical developments and has been repeatedly taken over by various sides. In 1907, the old beacon was replaced with a stronger electric one. It has been a National Monument since 1931 and has housed a military museum since 1916. Today it is one of the tourist attractions of Montevideo.
